Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cakelady83
Reviews.Content: I am here on my last night of 3. It has been a great experience. The reason I picked Navona is because of it's location and it did not disappoint! We literally walked everywhere. Of course, it's about a 2 min walk to the Piazza Navona and then about 5 min from the Pantheon, 10 to Trevi Fountain, 15 to Vatican City, 15 to Spanish Steps, and we even walked to the Colosseum. it was about a 30 min walk, but we got to see so much of Rome. The location is the BEST!!! The hotel itself is hard to find just like the other reviews say. Just get to the Piazza Navona and head north. Exit the Piazza in the north center exit and look to your left. Across the street is a large white building. Walk along that building and it will be 2 streets down on your right. You will see the famous green door. It's number 19. The street signs are on stone plaques on the buildings at the corners. It took me a while to know where to look for the street names. Okay, now about the hotel...It's very clean. We stayed in the apartment and like the other people said, there is a bed hanging from chains. It takes a little bit to get used to, but the Apartment is pretty spacious. A family of 4 could stay pretty easily, but more than that...no. One would have to be on the couch and the other in the twin bed past the kitchen area. The beds leave a lot to be desired. you'll probably be too tired to really care at the end of the day. The shower is quite small. I'm an average sized person and it was tight for me. They cleaned out room every day and gave us fresh towels. The woman at the front desk was most accommodating. The maps at the hotel are the best around and they have coupons on the back for Hard Rock Cafe and such. It was raining almost our entire trip, so our maps got wet, so we got 2 new ones each morning. Don't waste your Euros on the maps at the news stands. The hotel ones are much better. I really don't have any complaints. There were some quirky things like there aren't any outlets in the bathroom and you have to use the special rounded outlets for the hairdryer, but really, nothing to complain about. I really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “You Couldn't Ask For Better”
Reviews.Author: D T
Reviews.Content: This hotel is almost as perfect as they come in location and service. On our trip to Italy last summer we stayed here at the beginning and the end of our vacation. You couldn't ask for a better location in Rome. On a tiny quiet street steps from Piazza Navona and 10 Minute walk to the Vatican and about a half hour walk through the wonderful city of Rome to the Forum. The rooms of a good size, extremely comfortable and quiet. The staff we wonderful, we felt like family by the end of our stay. We had a family emergency while we were staying there and the staff went out of their way to help us contact our family back in Canada. We are heading to Rome again this summer and we are definetly staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: dionysio
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a splendid 3 nights long weekend in Rome. And one of the reasons I enjoyed this trip is Imperiun Suite Navona. My Deluxe room “Fontana di Trevi” (one of the three rooms in the other building across the sreet) was perfect and ideal for relaxing after a long walking day in Rome. The room was clean and modern, the bathroom also very clean and spacious, with all the amenities. Sat TV, free wifi, free bottle of wine, breakfast in bed always in time, mini bar, what else? Situated just one minute from piazza Navona, 3 minutes from Pantheon, the hole Rome in a walking distance! The place is a bit hard to locate because it is situated in a small road and there isn't any sign on the building, so you must locate the exact location in advance, easy for internet users. Definitely recommend this place to friends looking to explore Rome and definitely I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “5 star service”
Reviews.Author: ricmennj
Reviews.Content: Imperium Suite Navona is the perfect place to stay in Rome: unbeatable location (literally 100 yards from Piazza Navona but far enough to be a quiet location), great infrastructure (I loved the shower!) and incredible service (breakfast in the room like a 5 star hotel!!!). Staff is very helpful and the prices are fair considering the service you get. By all means, this will become my official play to stay and to send people in Rome (where very easily you can fall in a "tourist trap"). Grazie mille e complimenti Claudio!

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull and convinient stay!”
Reviews.Author: rinaki_yianni
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice of the hotel!The staff-Roman was very gentle in everything that we asked for. 5 minutes walk to the shopping area and very close to all the sightseeing areas. Although i read from some reviews that the hotel is noisy, i would definetely say that we heard nothing and the bed was very comfortable. I really enjoyed the breakfast because it was always on time and exactly as i wanted. The room and the bathroom were very clean and spacious, with all the amenities. I would stay again to my next visit in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Iloveholidays893
Reviews.Content: Incredible little hotel. Location is absolutely fantastic, just a minute from Piazza Navona. They made my boyfriends birthday very special by surprising us with a bottle of free Prosecco (complete with bow!). We stayed in a superior room which had a large jet bath. Staff are lovely and I can't recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room and great experiance!”
Reviews.Author: JessicaMedina
Reviews.Content: We had the standard room no extras but it was perfect for me and my partner. We got dropped off by the shuttle bus, the driver pointed where we had to go and wasn't hard to find its a big green door...Breakfast in the morning was defo a nice wake up call, the food was ok we wouldn't recommend the hot food options but me and my boyfriend loved the croissants! Location was perfect short distance from every attraction, piazza navona is just a 1min walk which is beautiful. The staff were so lovely we thought we were a bit of a pain but they were so helpful =] The wifi wasn't strong in our room but it worked. We had a lil sneak peak in the new building it looked lush next time we visit rome we have agreed to come back to imperium suite. we have recommended this hotel to friends and family. Rome is amazing, best holiday so far =D

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LindaetMichel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located... We were a minute away from Piazza Navona and everything else was just a short walk. The staff was friendly, and we got to stay in there new addition. They had just added 3 or 4 new rooms in the building in front, and we were the 1st guests to stay. The rooms were lovely and the breakfast was good. I have read a lot of bad reviews from this hotel but for us it was great. I can't say we would have felt the same had we stayed in the main building, I could see there might be the issue of the room right next to the front desk, but the room we got, no complaints at all!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Kristie P
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because the price and location. We booked the room with no extras. Everything was very close and the concierge was a very nice man who made sure we knew how to find our way back. My travel companion and I were very happy with the breakfast that was brought to our room every morning. It was a nice wake up call to get the day going. I will say the we had some trouble finding the hotel. Our shuttle was too large to get to the back street so we were left wandering around Rome with our luggage for a couple of hours trying to find it. Once we found the hotel, we were checked in quickly. The room was such a relief to see! It was clean and modern. We were off to enjoy Rome! The breakfast is simple, and the wifi is only available in the small lounge. I would recommend this hotel to anyone but those who want a lounge to chill in. For a budget hotel, this is great!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest hotel for that price! Ideal for romantic vacation”
Reviews.Author: Michael Y
Reviews.Content: I used the 'double superior' number, left from the reception desk. It has a nice jacuzzi! Clean, new, cozy interior, and completely silent (no motorbikes that wake you up in the morning). Hotel personal is friendly, they reply on email pretty fast, and I had no problems with booking or something like this. For me this place is ideal to have a romantic vacation. I'm young, and I hate the antique "romantic" hotels that feels like an ancient museum, with dust and gold. But Imperim Suite Navona is really nice, and we both feel it like the best hotel for a yong couple we ever visited. Especially the hot jacuzzi, big and clean comparing with other Rome hotels. And the location is ideal - it is the heart of historical Rome center, you can reach a lot of places in 5 minutes walk, and the spirit of this city is concentrated here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in the centre of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Naseem K
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of it's price and location. We had booked for a standard room but little did I know my boyfriend had arranged with them the week before to get an upgrade to a deluxe which was well worth it. It was clean, spacious, modern and pretty much perfect for us. Breakfast was ordered on a night before and was delivered to your room next morning. We loved the choice and the sweet croissants were lovely. If you like a full english on a morning though this is probably not the place for you, but we loved it and we actually missed our breakfast when we got home. The staff are so lovely and helpful, even carrying our heavy suitcase up the stairs for us and right to our room. You may get lost on arrival at the hotel as you dont expect it to be where it is. There is no clear sign of it and you have to buzz to be let it on the first floor but the street was very cute and quiet. The location is perfect, only a couple minute walk to the Piazza Navona. We walked to all attractions from the hotel and found that it was the best way to experience Rome. The Colosseum is about 20-25 minute walk but didn't seem like it at all, with Vatican city being only 10 minutes away. If you have time the Orange gardens on Aventine hill are a truly romantic setting and you can see a wonderful view of Rome from here (boyfriend proposed here). Everything about the hotel and holiday was very special. This was our first holiday together after being together over 6 years and little did I know we would come back engaged :) In general, this was a wonderful hotel and when we do plan to go back to Rome we would definitely choose to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy room”
Reviews.Author: tabby182
Reviews.Content: Really nice and romantic rooms. The place was abit hard to locate because it was situated in a small road and there wasn't a huge sign/signboard on the building. That said, the location was great - Piazza Navona (pretty much just across the road), Vatican, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps were all easily accessible. Breakfast is included in the price and are served in your rooms. You just have to fill up the "breakfast forms" to indicate your choice and pass it to the person at the desk the night before.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient”
Reviews.Author: wacfred
Reviews.Content: A small bed and breakfast tucked away between the Piazza Navona and the River Tiber with very nicely appointed bedrooms - apart from the very odd suite on the ground floor! A good conveniently situated location when visiting Rome - just minutes walk away from the Piazza Navona, Vatican, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. One question though - why can't Italian hotels or B&Bs serve REAL orange juice for breakfast ??

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but with "communal" noise”
Reviews.Author: jeetdragon
Reviews.Content: The location is spot on, only a couple minutes walk from Piazza Navona. The rooms are clean and the breakfast is decent. The place is somewhere in between a B&B and a hotel. They have the typical amenities that you have to pay to use; i.e. mini-bar and pay-per-view movies. Plus, there is someone at the desk until very late in the evening. But, the place is small and you see the same faces everyday; so more like a B&B in that sense. They also gave a free bottle of wine that we didn't drink, so I can't comment on the quality of it. We got the room right next to the reception desk, and as the previous reviewers stated you WILL get a lot of noise from the reception desk and the other guests. It normally doesn't last that long, but whenever someone calls the reception desk to make a reservation or other guests are asking for help to make arrangements, you can hear the entire conversation fairly clearly. Not too much noise late in the evening aside from the occasional guest coming back from dinner; because they have wood floors you can hear their steps clearly. Our room faced an inner courtyard, so there weren't a lot of noise from the outside. Tip on finding the place: if you take a taxi, ask the taxi to drop you off at the taxi rank on the north side of Piazza Navona. Head north towards the Museo Nazionale Romano di Palazzo Altemps. After passing what looks like a church on your right, take the 2nd street on your right, and the road bends to the left. Once you take the 2nd right, the door straight ahead just as the road bends is the door to the hotel on the 2nd floor, for us Americans, 1st floor for most others.

Reviews.Title: “Central location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: shugakookie
Reviews.Content: This review is for the newer renovated rooms which are not in the same building as the reception area. We stayed at the newly renovated "Coloseum room". The room was really newly renovated and really nice and modern. It is hard to find that kind of hotel at an affordable price in a really good location in an old city like Rome. We thought we didn't have a TV when we first got there, but we figured it out later on. It was one of those things were you press a button and the TV comes out from the desk!!! Ok so they have that at some hotels here in the U.S. but I wasn't expecting that in Rome. lol. The have free breakfast every morning and OMG it is delicious. You have to place your order the night before and they will deliver your food right at your door at the time you specified on your order sheet!! There is also free wifi!! The bed was comfy and the bathroom was so clean. To top it off, the complimentary red wine was waiting for us in our room!! The location was perfect. It is a 5 minute walk to the Piazza Navona and the Pantheon where you could also find a lot of places to eat. We also walked to the Trevi fountain and to the Vatican (prob a 30 minute walk). I would recommend taking the bus to the Colosseum as it is a bit far. Also, from the hotel, it is only 11 euros to get to the train station. From the airport to the hotel, there are a whole bunch of shuttle services that can be quite expensive so make sure you ask around for the cheapest option. The airport is a little bit out of the city. The service was fantastic. The guy at the reception is the friendliest and nicest ever. He said he has been working there for a long long time! The negatives: The hotel is actually a few floors rented out from a condo/apartment building so it is hard to find. I recommend that you do your research on the detailed directions before you go. Even the locals don't know where it is, if you plan to just ask around. The reception area is not in the same building as the rooms (if you are staying at the newly renovated ones). Also, I don't recommend booking at the older rooms unless they are a lot cheaper. I saw one of them and they are so basic (looked like a hospital room). They have an elevator to go up to the reception area/room but only 1 person and 1 luggage fits in there. I love this hotel and if I ever find myself back in Rome, I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great first stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: TripJunkyLondon
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay with my partner, at the Imperium Suite Navona . I used previous reviews on trip advisor to select this hotel and was not disappointed. No problems finding the hotel, as the shuttle driver knew exactly where it was. However, to avoid any confusion, make a note of the exact address of the hotel and map it, before you go. The room are located on the first floor of the building and it's listed on the brass entry buzzer system. The location is exellent,very quiet but feels very safe. A very short walk to Piazza Navona (which is stunning) and from there you can get your bearings to all the historical locations you would want to see. All within walking distnace. We had a superior suite, which was ideal. My partner is 6'3" and needs space! I had read that many people experienced quite cramped accommadation in the centre of Rome, but no such problems here. Ample room to walk around the large double bed and a large bathroom with a spa bath for me! The staff were very friendly, helpful and always smiling. They were quite happy to confirm our airport transfer for us (booked via expedia) which arrived bang on time. If you want a small, intimate, clean, friendly hotel in a great location then you could not go wrong. But if you want large foyers, breakfast/restaurant areas, gym etc then this is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: reiseelin
Reviews.Content: We stayed a Imperium Suite Navona in the beginning of September this year. We did have some problems finding the hotel because of a closed street and a taxi driver who dropped us of at the wrong place, but once we found it we were very happy with our booking. We stayed in a Double deluxe room across the street from the reception. Our room - Colosseum - was quite big (for Rome standards), clean and very stylish. We loved the fact that they served breakfast in the room, and the service was excellent. The location is great, really in the middle of everything. 1 minute walking to Piazza Navona, and both the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain within 10 minutes walking. Lots of nice little restaurants in the neighbourhood, and we got good recommondations from the hotel. I would absolutely stay there next time I'm in Rome, and would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem...do not pass a room up at this place!”
Reviews.Author: Hello2me
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for five nights and had a great experience. The reviews don't do this place justice! It's a three minute walk from Piazza Navona and EXTREMELY centrally located to everything else...you can walk everywhere! I researched many hotels and you will not find a better value for the location and accommodations. Plus, the staff is so pleasant and helpful. They even bring you a huge breakfast spread every morning which is included in the price. Also, no one mentioned it before, but there is a cute lit tle wine bar that sets candlelight tables right outside the front door of the hotel at night so you can rest and enjoy a glass of wine after a long day of sightseeing. You don't want to be any closer to a Piazza/attraction then where this hotel is located because it would be too noisy. In the morning we loved to lay in bed and listen to the city wake up at a nice, quiet volume. If you can get a room here book it immediately!

Reviews.Title: “Great value !”
Reviews.Author: sunrise352
Reviews.Content: Great location with friendly and professionnal staff. The room was a basic double room, modern and clean, with a good choice of breakfast options, including actual scrambled eggs! ...delivered right to your room. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended, with a couple of minor limitations,”
Reviews.Author: BikerChick99
Reviews.Content: Recommended. Hotel is on 2nd floor (1st floor in European terms) Very friendly service. But, if you're a person who wants a big lobby and room service, this is not for you. Large flat screen, we never used. Air conditioning took a while to cool when you first arrived, but worked well. If you're a senior, be aware that you must climb in and out of a large shower/tub. We had 2 couples/2 rooms - both were clean, one room (Navona) needed a paint job and the caulking in the tub was no longer good and leaked all over the marble floor when we took a shower, requiring about 3 towels to clean up. I did not bother to complain about it until we left, knowing it would require a room change, since the caulk has to dry. I'm sure it was taken care of after our departure. The wireless was free and good, the room and bathroom were both a good size for Rome, we didn't feel cramped. Good location, just off the Piazza Navona, which was a nice place to eat or stroll in the evenings, with musicians, etc. The hotel was within walking distance from many sights, although we frequently took the city bus. There's a bus stop and TI station very close to the hotel. The hotel is NOT close to the metro, if that is a priority. Didn't think I would liike eating the the free breakfast in my room (hot scrambled eggs, cold meats, cheese, bread), but found I missed the convenience when we moved to a new hotel after leaving Rome- breakfast was always delivered on time. Would definitely stay here again. h

Reviews.Title: “Rare jewel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Alejandrinasanders
Reviews.Content: The +++: excellent location (only 5 min walking distance from Piazza Navona and Pantheon), very friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms. The ---: breakfast is served in the room at a requested time. Although it may sound convenient at first, you really need to be up and ready by then, otherwise you risk of having a cold breakfast. Coffe and orange juices could be of better quality/taste. Rooms need a bit of maintenance such as wall painting and bath descales. Family friendly hotel but not very convenient for families with babies and strollers as elevator, hallway and rooms are very small.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, very clean and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A K
Reviews.Content: We stayed with Imperium Suite Navona in late August/early September in one of their 'double deluxe'/superior rooms - the Trevi Fountain room - and it was perfect for us! As mentioned by others, this room is in a townhouse located on the opposite side of the laneway to the building that houses the reception. But this turned out to be no inconvenience at all - reception was moments away, and we had our own key to get into our building and our room, no buzzing required. The room was cleaned to perfection every day, the breakfast was brought to our room exactly on time, and the staff were always friendly and ready to help with any enquiry. There's also free wifi and there are the usual basic mini bathroom products as well (shampoo, shower gel, etc). The location is the real icing on the cake - it has all the benefits of being right next to the Piazza Navona (5 minutes' walk to the Pantheon or Castel Sant'Angelo, 10 minutes to the Spanish Steps, 15 minutes to the Vatican or Coliseum), but conveniently nestled a few laneways back so it doesn't suffer from tourist or traffic noise, bright lights at night or anything like that. We had a little window framed with beautiful hanging ivy that let in a lovely cool breeze, but the air con was also very good. We also recommend the little cafe just outside, in the laneway of the Imperium Suite Navona. It's actually a small gallery, but has three little tables set up for lunch and dinner. The veal rolls and the dessert were both absolutely scrumptious, and it was nice to have a change from the usual pasta/pizza/gelateria places we'd tried. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Our new hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jtotman
Reviews.Content: Imperium Suite Navona probably can't be called a "hidden gem," given that it's ranked so highly on TripAdvisor. However, I hadn't been aware of it during my past visits to Rome (usually staying in Campo dei Fiori or the Piazza Navona area). I'm glad my wife and I found it, though, because I doubt we'd find a better or more comfortable hotel at this price, with this location. Aside from the hotel's perfect location (well positioned for sightseeing, restaurants, bars, and shops), we had a big, clean, and well-appointed (modern, but not tacky) room; a strong air conditioning; a large, clean bathroom; and a free bottle of wine. The room was in a separate building, across the street from the reception, but the reception is open 24-hours per day, delivers breakfast to the rooms, and is very helpful. In fact, when we were trying to re-route our flight back to the U.S. at the last minute (weather cancellations), the reception let us use their computer and made some last-minute arrangements for a car service and breakfast. The entrance is hard to find, and there's no outward sign, so know the address, then look for the buzzer with the "Imperium Suite Navona" label. Our room (and several others) were in a secure building across the street. The rooms each have a separate "Roman" theme (ours was the Trevi Fountain room, with Trevi Fountain artwork hanging inside). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel near Piazza Navona”
Reviews.Author: Michele_100
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and found the location of the hotel perfect for sightseeing. It was walking distance to most major sites including the Vatican, Trevi fountain, Spanish Steps and Borghese Museum. The room was great. It was a plus to be near the reception desk so if we had any questions we just stuck our head out of the room and the person at the reception desk came right over. The breakfast was a modest continental delivered to the room when specified. The people at the reception desk were exceptionally nice and helpful with restaurant recommendations. The room was adequate size with A/C and free Wi-FI and kept clean. One minor issue for me since I am petite was stepping into the jacuzzi tub to use the shower which was part of the tub. Also although they had a small elevator, we usually walked a flight of stairs to get to the hotel reception and our room. Other than those 2 things if u want a nice comfy place and don't need big hotel amenities this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average facilities”
Reviews.Author: TrippyAG
Reviews.Content: More of an apartment than a hotel (ie no real reception/public bathrooms/common space). I don't mean that in a negative way, it's just it was a bit unusual (literally no external sign indicating that it was a hotel). That said, the stay was fine and it's a reasonable tourist-class option. The location is perfect-- centrally located, but on a quiet street. Price was very good for central Rome. The room was good sized w/ a/c. The bathroom quite large and modern. The staff were pleasant. On the con-side-- bathroom was a bit dusty and not as clean as I would have liked. It wasn't outrageously filthy or anything beyond the pale, but a couple stray hairs in the tub put me off. Again, it wasn't that big a deal, obviously the tub had been cleaned, it likely was just a stray from the air kind of thing. But still, a bit of an 'ew' factor. At the end of the day, pros and cons. Overall, I say a solid average. I wouldn't go there for luxury or a romantic atmosphere. But if I were just interested in having a convenient 'base' to tour from, I'd probably give it another chance.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED IT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: StarTravelBug21
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here at the end of July 2011 and we feel in love with the hotel and Rome! So want to go back soon! Finding it: It is tucked away ion a little street, but is easy peasy to find when you know where it is! I highly recommend taking a map that has all the street names listed on it, then it is easier to locate. We has aloso looked at the photos on here first which helped! Our taxi driver pointed us in completly the wrong direction (as cars cannot fit up the street) so it took us a little while to find it! Staff: AMAZING...all the staff speak good english, were so friendly and helpful, went out of their way to help us! Gave us a really good free map of Rome which was so useful! The Hotel and Room: It is on the 1st floor, so there are stairs to climb - not not hard! You have to buzz the intercom to get in (reception is manned 24hrs and this was nice as it felt safe) We stayed in the standard room, which is down the corridor from the reception. It was a good sixe, very clean, and very sweet! Air con worked which was a big bonus as it was so hot outside! Breakfast: You have a tick box selction each evening to fill out what you want and what time to be delivered - we ticked everything (!) and it was all great! Delivered bang on time each day, and it was a luxury eating breakfast in bed! Location: PERFECT! we couldnt have wished for more! 1 minute walk to Piazza Navona, 2 minutes to the river and bridges, 10 minutes from the Spanish Steps+Trevi Fountain, 20 minutes to the Colesseum. There were some great local restaurants about 1 minute walk from the hotel, and the hotel staff gave some great recommendations of other places near by to. There are local buses/taxis very nearby if you want to travel this way, but we walked everywhere - all the main sites were within easy walking distance. Rome is very easy to navigate (with a good map!) and we had so much fun walking down all the little cobbled streets and discovering new sites and places, which you wouldn't get if you got the bus! The food is amazing, and the ice cream is the best we have ever had! Avoid the restaurants on Piazza Navona, as these are more pricey and not as cute as the little side street ones! We felt really safe walking around day or niht in Rome - but always aware as pick pockets can sttrike at any time! But we were fine, and din't have any troubles at all!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: dcp1950
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, nice/clean/ room, great staff, nice breakfast and air conditioner! What more could you ask for? Would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: wellwhynot
Reviews.Content: Down a back street near Piazza Navona, Imperium Suite is just what you need for a city break. Centrally located, nice clean room, good bathroom, friendly staff. If you don't want all the trappings of a traditional hotel - reception area, bar etc, this is a perfect base for exploring Rome. We liked the fact it was off the main drag, but near enought to nip to Piazza Navonna for a coffee. Breakfast is adequate - but this isn't important for us. Overall, highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, fab location”
Reviews.Author: Bunny2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and found the location of the hotel perfect for sightseeing. Trevi, Pantheon almost on the doorstep as is Piazza Navona. We thought the room would be noisy as we were by the Reception Desk but actually it wasn't so we were surprised! The room was spacious and we had a bath which was a welcome sight after a long day walking in 40°C heat! We werent that impressed with the breakfast, although it was nice to have it in our room. The list of choices was the same each day so it was repetitive and coffee/tea were not great! However the location of the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: mrt1423
Reviews.Content: The location, room and staff were great! Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this hotel - Terrific Location and Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: gottatravel123
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying for one week at this hotel. The location was key. It's in the center of Rome, steps away from the Piazza Navona and the Pantheon, and we were able to walk to every destination on our list. Rooms were spacious and clean. Breakfast was excellent and fresh - brought promptly to our room each morning. All of the staff were lovely and extremely helpful - from giving directions to making restaurant reservations and recommendations to even helping us practice a bit of our Italian. Who could ask for anything more? Simply a fantastic stay. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “The 3 L - Location, Location and Location”
Reviews.Author: Geo_Denmark
Reviews.Content: That a nice little hotel, perfect for at nice time in Rome. Located 2 min from Plaza navona, 5 min from Pantheon and 1/2 min to L'orso 80, top class Italian restaurant. Try the antipasto misto del casa, a real treat for 15 euro. The hotel is very clean and has large rooms. The breakfast is served on a tray, soo you need to eat on the bed, but that is very romatic for couple trip. A good tip, it to get the hotel to arrange the pick up, from the airport, it cost 50 euro. We tried the train and taxi, that was 60 euro, 30 euro for the train (2 persons).

Reviews.Title: “very much enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: natjamesrn
Reviews.Content: we were very pleased with our stay at your hotel. your emails were prompt when we made our reservations. the personnel was helpful and friendly. the rates were reasonable and the room was clean and comfortable. breakfast was good and served promptly as we had tours planned for the mornings. we were extremely close to piazza navona which is located close to good restaurants and shopping. we would definitely stay at your hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Surprising!!!”
Reviews.Author: bcgriffith2
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Europe, so everything was a little new to us. But Rome was our first stop. We arranged a shuttle from the airport to the hotel. Since our plane was late, the shuttle wasnt there. Although the shuttle was set up by the hotel, it wasnt actually the hotel doing it. So thats no reflection on the hotel. So we took another. And boy did we wish the arranged shuttle was there. The random airport shuttle dropped us off somewhere close. But actually not. The street the hotel is on is not very big, and not on every map. It took about 30 minutes with 2 50 pound bags to find the hotel. It was a little weird at first. It appeared to be an apartment converted into a very small hotel. It felt like you were staying in someones house. But after we warmed up to that, it was very nice. The staff was very helpful, and went out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. The rooms werent too big, but we didnt spend much time there. The bathrooms were cleaned very well each day. The best part about the hotel was the location. It was only about a block off Piazza Navona. The breakfast served each day was on time, and as ordered. The only issue I had with this hotel was a somewhat lack of privacy. Our room was right off the small lobby, and behind the front desk. But all in all, it was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean & Friendly!!”
Reviews.Author: Flava3
Reviews.Content: SUMMARY: It was a brilliant city break, hotel was in a great location 2 minutes from Piazza Navona and was very clean which is what we wanted. We would stay here again and we slept very well because we were so tired everyday! We were probably the last ones in most night as we only heard the door bell one night. It did rain every day we were there but it would be sunny until about 5/6pm and then there would be a down pour and it would clear again leaving the sun shining until about 8.30. The last day we were allowed to leave our luggage after checking out as our flight wasn’t until 10.00pm. They also let us use the facilities across the road to freshen up. They have some rooms in the apartment block across the road and they are newly decorated rooms. There was a taxi rank just before the Piazza Navona square and we paid 30 euros to the airport. Taxi From Airport to Hotel: When my husband and I arrived in Rome we went to the Taxi stand outside the Ciampino airport (white taxi’s). We had read that it is a flat fee of 30 euros and told the taxi man where we wanted to go and said “will it be 30 euros?” he replied, “no, it will be 50 euros”. At this point we were concerned about getting ripped-off. Then he went onto say that “there is a marathon on at the moment and all traffic has been diverted around the city”. We were still unhappy about this. He then told us to wait and there were 3 other ladies that also joined the queue, he then asked them where they were going and then suggested we could all share the taxi and pay 30 euros each. The taxi man was using his Sat Nav to get us to the hotel and he managed to get us as close as possible. But he could not take his car down to the hotel so we had to walk to the hotel, which was fine because it wasn’t far. Hotel: The hotel is quite difficult to find but fortunately we had read the previous reviews and had a look on Google maps. It was basically a green door to this apartment block and the hotel is on the first floor of this apartment. There is a lift and we used it because we had a suitcase and a trolley, it was bit of a squeeze for the both of us and our luggage, and we are both of slim built! The receptionist was very friendly and welcoming. We arrived at about 11ish and were worried about arriving earlier than the check-in time, the lady said that it was fine and that we could check in early! Bonus! We could start the site seeing straight-away!! We were given a key to our room but not a key to the front door. You had to press the bell to be let in but this was manned 24 hours. Room: We stayed in the room that was in the lobby area but further away from the reception desk it was called Navona. The room was nice and comfortable but not that spacious. The first thing we checked was the safe as we had read in a previous review ‘the safe was not attached to the wall’ – luckily it was. The bathroom had a Jacuzzi that did not work but we couldn’t be bothered to complain about this and just used the shower and had a bath. The bathroom window had a hazardous handle and my husband scrapped against it on the way to the toilet in the middle of the night! Beware of the window handle! The room was quite dark with little light – although this was because our room faced into the courtyard. The walls are very thin and we could hear the people in the next room and we could also hear people downstairs in the courtyard. Because our room was in the reception area we could hear the noise from the lobby too, although having the TV on drowned out all the noise. There are a few English channels but we only had it on as background noise and to check the news. Breakfast was served in our room and you would have to pre-order what you wanted the night before – we were very happy with breakfast. I didn’t like the orange or pineapple juice and we had the bread, scrambled eggs, bacon, croissants and tea. Itinerary: We went for 4 days and as soon as we checked in and freshened up – we went to grab a bite to eat on the go. Headed toward Piazza Navona and just before you cross the road into the square there is a pizzeria on the corner. Day 1: Headed to look at the Panthon, Trevi Fountain, towards the Spanish Steps along via Condotti & via Del Corso (main shopping road) and finally to Piazza del Popolo. Had Dinner @ Cafe Barocco, good food. Day 2: Colosseum, Palatine Hill, Roman Forum, Piazza Venezia (ate at some cafe was overpriced and it was raining), Monument to Victor Emmanuel II, Sant Maria Del Popolo & Pincio Gardens (amazing views). Dinner was near the Pantheon @ Trattoria Al Pantheon-Acquisto Cartasi, good food but service could be better. Day 3: St Peter’s Basilica, Vatican Museums & Sistine Chapel and lunch @ pizzeria in the Museum. Dinner & drinks were at Campo del’ Fiori first restaurant on the left as you enter the square from Piazza Navona. The food was not very good and I would recommend this square for drinks and hanging out late into the night also there are clubs near too but we were too tired to check them out. Also the clubs are not all in one location either. Day 4: Went to the Vatican as heard the Pope was here today, Castel Sant’Angelo and explored Piazza Navona. Dinner @ Anima Sapori, food was good but portions was small but adequate. It was on the side street next to Tre Scalani on Piazza Navona.

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: igor188590
Reviews.Content: We had absolutely a lovely stay. Enjoyed the location and we felt part of a REAL Roman experience. A tastefull luxery. We had two different rooms in two days and preferred the colourfull-room even more than the neo-barokroom. Good reception,

Reviews.Title: “Great location but can be a challenge to find”
Reviews.Author: BubbleOC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an apartment building, having just one floor. When you arrive at the building, all you will see in the name of the hotel among a list of others. You have to be buzzed in to the building. The staff at the hotel were wonderful. They happily made dining suggestions and reservations. They also served breakfast in your room daily, most likely due to the lack of space, but it was very convenient. My only complaint would be the noise level in the building, but beyond that, I would happily stay at Imperium Suites Navona again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: cmbassett
Reviews.Content: Just took my first trip to Rome, and this somehow out of the way yet centrally located B&B a stone's throw from Piazza Navona was the perfect place to stay. The room was comfortable (even if the bathroom was set up a bit strangely) and the staff was amazing. Every member of the staff went out of their way to make us feel comfortable. The daily breakfast delivery was also a nice perk.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to any of our friends coming to Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Allieb03
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I just went to Rome for the first time and stayed in this charming hotel. The service was excellent, our choice of breakfast was served promptly at a time we chose every morning. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location was excellent as it was on a quieter street that was within walking distance to all of the major sites we wanted to see in Rome, the Vatican, the colosseum, the pantheon, the Trevi fountain, etc. Also, if you are staying at this hotel, they recommended a restaurant just down from the hotel, L'Orso 80, that was delicious. We went there a few times during our stay. Overall, this was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: KelleyDavis99
Reviews.Content: We arrived back last night after 4 days of staying at the imperium, and really can't express how lovely this hotel is. Yes it is small and you can hear quite a bit of what goes on outside of your room, but to be honest it really didn't matter. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and friendly, the rooms were very clean, the breakfast was lovely and best of all you are only a stones throw away from the piazza Navona, which anyone that has every been to Rome will know, is central to all the main attractions....word of advice for anyone that hasn't been to rome before, don't eat in the Piazzas as the food isn't that great and very overpriced, instead try the restaurants in the backstreets, the Piazza however is nice to have a drink and watch the world go by.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, comfortable secret”
Reviews.Author: nycgirl0729
Reviews.Content: My fiancee just returned from a week in Europe. We spent a couple nights in Rome and through our research decided to stay at the Imperium Suite Navona. What a pleasant surprise! The hotel was tough to find at first, but then you realize how convenient the location is. Also, the hotel is on a quiet street, a block or so away from the Piazza Navona so you are guaranteed a quiet night. I have to be honest, I was skeptical as we made our way to the second floor of the building when we arrived to check in, but once we were shown our room (one of the new deluxe rooms in the building literally across the street), we felt at home. The room is spacious, extremely clean and comfortable. Breakfast comes with the rate and also, pleasantly surprised. You are given quite a nice, large breakfast - not stingy at all! I was very impressed with the quality of the food as well. Oh, and free wi-fi! he woman who works at the front desk (owner maybe?) is very nice and helpful, the people who work there are very nice as well. Again, the location is great, the rooms are comfortable - not one complaint. And for the price, you cannot beat it in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: rdchawk
Reviews.Content: The hotel/townhouse is a fantastic place to stay, the staff are friendly and helped organised our airport shuttle back to the airport - breakfast was good, room was excellant, everywhere was spotless. Located in the hustle and bustle but is quiet. Only a minute or so walk to the nearby Piazza Navona to be in a busy area but also situated in a quiet back street so is nice and quiet at night. Hotel is situated well within walking distance to virtiually everything Rome and Vatican have to offer. The only downside (and its a very small one so no way should it affect the score) is that because its a townhouse there isn't a big sign or neon lights advertising the hotel, it is just a small plaque by the buzzer entry system. Couple of tips - try the restaurant La Foccacia in Della la Pace - excellant for food and value for money and a proper woodburning pizza cooking experience. Also for the love of god try the ice cream at Marriotts right by the entrancer to the piazza navona -absoloutely gorgeous!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful room, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: jeskalina
Reviews.Content: Located in a central position in the heart of Rome, with literally a two minute walk to the Piazza Navona, this hotel is a great place to stay for any sightseer. Staff where very friendly, rooms were very modern and clean , overall we were very pleased with the service offered. Our only complaint would be that it took our taxi driver over an hour to find as it is in a quiet street but once found it is beautiful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding class”
Reviews.Author: Christina550625
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over a long weekend. Fantastic little charming hotel just behind Piazza Navona. Situated in an old apartment on second floor. There are only 6 rooms. Small but very stylish rooms with all comfort you need. Good breakfast which is served at your room. Makes you feel very spoilt! Clean and quiet. The staff is very kindly and serviceminded. I give my best recomendations and next time we go to Rome we will surely live here.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, comfortable and Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Tk1515
Reviews.Content: Stayed At the Suites from 9/16 thru 9/21... Service ... super, 24 hrs, very helpful with everything Room .... Very Clean, small (but they all are) Location ... less than 10 minutes to Vatican / Trevi Fountain / Pantheon. right atop the Piazza Navona which id full of life. Great streets leading to the main tourists spots with nice cafe and shops The only down side is no place to sit outside as you unwind between trips to the sights...would be nice to have roof top or outside seating to enjoy a nice Chianti Classico.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Deal and Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: npnewyorkcity
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Rome and stayed at Imperium Suite Navona. I stayed there with my mom. We both were delightfully happy with the accommodations and services. Very friendly staff, great renovated pristine rooms and bath. Cable TV, and mini bar.Breakfast is brought to your room daily. No fancy lobby, but who needs that when you have gorgeous Rome to hang out in. Walking distance to all the attractions. A great price, in a great location. I would recommend to anyone and I plan on staying here again if I go.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: Telthearna
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a long weekend in Rome as we liked the fact that customer service was rated so highly from previous reviews. We can confirm that the service is excellent, the staff can not do enough to make your stay as pleasant as possible. Breakfast in bed every morning was a real treat. The hotel is small, only about 6 rooms, but the location is perfect, only a 5 minute walk from the Plazza Navona and about 20 minutes from the Vatican. For a weekend break, the hotel was just what we wanted. We had a superior room and it was a lovely size and the bathroom was huge, plenty of hot water. There are plenty of places to eat nearby and the service and food was great in all of them. If you want to visit the Sistene Chapel, make sure you get there very early as the queue's can get very long indeed. If we go back to Rome, we would certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - with a bit of advice”
Reviews.Author: DigitalGhost
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Imperium Suite Navona. The room was really nice (although small, but thats probably true of many places in Rome). Lucia, the hostess, was awesomely helpful and friendly. Having breakfast served in the room was nice. The free internet worked well. We would definitely stay there again! A couple of pieces of advice: The bathroom was TINY. The shower was so small that I had to walk in sideways. I would not recommend that shower for anyone over 200 pounds. Once in the shower, though, it is nice and newly remodelled with excellent water pressure. I don't know if this is a European thing or something, but we had a bunch of our stuff (computer, ipod, miscellaneous junk) on the desk in the room, and the housekeeping staff moved it all into the closet - I guess so they could wipe off the desk. They did this on two nights in a row, until we said something on the third night. So, if you don't want them touching your stuff, let them know. All in all we really liked this place and thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “More Like a PENSIONE”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler1221
Reviews.Content: This hotel (I use that term loosely) is quite frankly not IMPERIUM! While the service is impeccable, the location is incredible; this is a 6 room Pensione and nothing more. Don't be fooled by the advertisements. The rooms are in a small home off the Piazza Novona and there are several other apartments in the same building. You can hear everything from your neighbors (and I MEAN EVERYTHING) and the "lobby" is in the same space as two of the hotel rooms. I was extremely disappointed with this place when I arrived, but I will say that the location is ideal. So, if you don't mind hearing your neighbors, could care less about being in apartment building, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this one room...”
Reviews.Author: Denzlite
Reviews.Content: All the other reviews here were helpful. It's a great location. The staff is amazing. It is difficult to find, but that makes it nice since you get away from the crowds. The woman who manages this place is exceptionally wonderful. However - Here's the deal. The owner essentially bought an entire floor in an otherwise residential building. It's kind of nice, right? The thing is, it's not really meant to have a lobby area - the receptionist sits at a desk in the small hallway outside the rooms on the right of the entrance. I really wish we would have had a room down the left-side of the hallway, but our room was right-most room. Right outside our door was the reception, computer/desk and kitchen. Which is all crammed into a corner at the end of the hallway since it's really just a floor of a residence, right? So at first we were thrilled, until we got in our room and closed the door. You can hear EVERY THING and I mean everything. So we were jet lagged and desperately needed to sleep and it's 2am and I can hear the guy on call outside in the hallway typing. And you can tell he's trying to be so quiet. And then we layed awake and all of the sudden it's 6am and they're out there getting breakfast ready in the closet that is the kitchen... and they're trying so hard to be quiet... which is so frustrating! If they would just do their thing and not worry, but they're trying to be quiet just makes it worse cause we can even hear them whispering! AGHGGHG! First night in Rome and I'm thinking about what I'm going to write on TripAdvisor! Second night in Rome and I'm ready to stab my ears. Jeez. Wish someone would have told us to get a room as far away from the kitchen area as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky Accommodation, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: emmac1980
Reviews.Content: As previous reviews had mentioned how challenging the accommodation could be to find we opted to get a taxi to the Suite from the station and were charged 30 euro but it did drop us off right next to the street, we later found out that the taxi should cost no more than 15-20 euro so make sure you ask. The accommodation was brilliant for the price and the location was unbeatable with some great restaurants really close by (you need to reserve a table at the Old Bear hence why we never actually got to eat there), the Piazza Navona is literally 1 minutes walk, Vatican and Trevi Fountain 10 minutes. Breakfast is adequate and its pleasant having it served in your room, the staff were always very accommodating and provided additonal tea etc as and when required. There is Sky tv, a minibar, safe and plenty of storage in the room too, free wifi is available you just need to get a code from reception, the shower room was sufficient. The windows are only single glazed so if anything does pass outside you can hear it, though fortunately the Suite is on a really small, and quiet street so we had no problems with noise, even from the reception area which is in very close proximity to all of the rooms. We would definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: SannaLi
Reviews.Content: Location is awesome! Less than 1min walk to piazza Navona! 10 min to all shops, Popolo, Pantheon etc. One of the cleanest hotel I have ever been! Service was great, breakfast is always served in your room and you can choose from their menu what you choose to eat (everyday!). Timerange is from 7.30-10.30. I recommend this hotel. Price was really good by booking forehand. Worth every penny! Rooms look exatly like in their website, even better. Loved the interior. Very classic and elegant interior with modern thouch! Loved the lamps! Free internet that actually worked! Really satisfied customers from Finland!

Reviews.Title: “non plus ultra!”
Reviews.Author: mmargot
Reviews.Content: falled in love with this lovely place! Perfect location, great value for money (we had special rates for long stay) and a delicious staff 24 h at your disposal! Lucia take care of us every day, suggesting good restaurants and giving us informations about museums, trains, guided tours! great the breakfast, the welcome coffee and every day free tea, american coffee& cakes! GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location on a quiet alley. Perfect location to walk around Rome”
Reviews.Author: BoerumHillDean
Reviews.Content: We were arriving after an overnight flight and had booked a car through the Imperium Suites Navona to pick us up at the airport, which was a good idea, as I don't think 1) any taxi would have found it and 2) we would have found it after the schlep from the Spagna subway station (about 15 minutes walk). They let us have our room (the Quirinale, facing the viccolo) before the official check in time, which was nice, and we were pleasantly surprised. King size bed, and decently sized bathroom. Some have complained about the size of the shower - I'm a tall guy (6') and while it wasn't a huge American sized shower, it was perfectly fine. The room was clean, and there was plenty of space in the closet to hang clothes. There was also a little fridge that we used to put drinks in. Some have complained about noise from other rooms - we heard a little talking, but nothing major. It's not really a hotel though - it's the second floor of a building just a minute's walk north of Piazza Navona. The other floors are private apartments. The location was FANTASTIC. There's no real public space which was fine, as we only spent mornings and nights in our room. The rest of the time we were out in Rome or doing a day trip (go to Orvieto and Ostia Antica!). Lucia, Ramon and Claudio were all wonderfully nice and helpful. We would stay here again if we make it back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “nice but...”
Reviews.Author: williyfogg
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in a superior room with spa bath. The hotel is in an excellent location, perfect for exploring rome. However it really is tucked away and we recommend a detailed map as the street did not appear on our tourist maps and even the taxi driver found it difficult to find. Taxi from the termini rail station to the hotel costs nearly 30 euro, a far cheaper option is to get the number 70 bus which stops at the top right hand side of piazza navona (two minutes walk from hotel). The hotel is smartly decorated, modern and the rooms have all the facilities you would expect (flatscreen tv, mini bar, safe, heated towel rails etc.) The service was very good and the office & staff were convieniently located - perhaps a little too close by (literally outside of our door). The main office is situated in the corridor, and when lying in bed we could hear the staff typing on their computer. In order to feel any privacy we needed to keep the tv on at all times. The staff did their best to keep noise to a minimum however it was a little strange having them so close by. In terms of cleanliness the room was spotless and well maintained (new soap every day!). However, to my disappointment the spa bath jets had not been cleaned out for some time - I only found this out after running the bath, getting in, then turning them on - within seconds I was covered in brown gunk from the water pipes. Not particularly relaxing or indulgent! Breakfast was very good, varied slightly each day (different pastries, yoghurts etc.). The choice and quantity was just right. Also a nice touch was the guest welcome table which had drinks and jaffa cakes available throughout the day. Our main issue during our stay was we believe beyond the control of the hotels owners - there was a significant amount of building work going on in the building next door. Noise began at around 9am in the morning and continued relentlessly, this meant no lay in's we were up and out pretty much straight after breakfast as the noise was very loud. Noise was usually over by the time we returned at around 6pm each evening. Unfortunately from the scaffolding it looks like the building work is pretty subtstantial and may continue for a few months. In terms of restaurants the nearby L'orso 80 (literally 20 seconds walk away) is very good, excellent quality food at a good price - don't be put off by the dated looking exterior - inside it is very nice. In general the smaller restaurants on the side streets seem to have better quality, better priced food than the large fairy lit outdoor restaurants near the main tourist sights - these are great for people watching but very over priced. We had a lovely time in rome - highly recommended for a short break and if the hotel had a clean bath, less noise and more space between rooms and staff then we would have definitely given it a higher overall rating.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it, will you?”
Reviews.Author: pean
Reviews.Content: This is a tough one to review. We liked it here, but it is a special place with some problems. Great location 3 minutes from Piazza Navona in a nice neigborhood with a good choice of restaurants and minimarkets. I recommend The Old Bear (ask for a table upstairs) and Orso 80 for a relaxed dinner. The hotel is totally hidden in a small vicolo and no "Hotel" sign. Going from Fiumicino (Leonardo da Vinci) it is comfortable with a prebooked limousine, we used http://www.rome-limousine-airport.com/ , 40 Euro for the trip and they take you to the door. The hotel is on the first floor, and you have to use the stairs. Only 6 rooms, 2 is so called superior rooms, slightly bigger and with a jacuzzi (not working in our room). I have uploaded the ground floor for your information. Descent breakfast served in your room, but for some reasons the bread was not fresh and we could only have 2 slices. Strange. Breakfast is served at the time you wish and it came just in time every morning. TV with all kind of international channels from many countries. As other reviewers have mentioned there is a problem with noise from the reception, you can hear everything from your room. No problems nighttime, but in the daytime it was irritating if you wanted to sleep in the late afternoon after a "busy" day in Rome. Free wifi if you bring you labtop or Iphone, you need a code from the reception. Not quite sure if it works in all rooms, it did in ours. I recommend the place but don't kill me if you don't like it for you might or you might not. The hotel had new owners during our stay and there was some signs that it will be for the better, but time will show. We might come back and we might not. Not quite sure. A bonus tip: Go to Al Greco in Via Condotti, go to the cashier to the left and ask for 2 G&T, go to the bar and they make a generous drink and you wil have canapees and different snacks as well. 12 Euro for 2 drinks. Tip 1 euro when you order, that will do the trick. They even aks which gin you prefer (Tanqueray is the answer)

Reviews.Title: “A Rare Gem!”
Reviews.Author: chriskia
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were touring around Europe and Rome was our first stop. Initially we were shocked when we found out that this suite was situated on the first floor of a building in one of the quieter and smaller street of Rome. So, our first impression on this suite were mixed. However, we have soon slowly grown to love this suite over the 4 days of stay because of the unexpectedly good service. We had free wifi, breakfast in bed, rail heater in toilet, free excellent Rome maps and cable TV - all unexpected for the rate we paid for! The highlight of our stay has also got to be the staff for this suite. Here I would really want to commend Ramone, one of the night receptionist (this suite is staffed 24 hours a day) who was really polite and made us felt special. He even let us use his computer for some urgent purposes. He also made sure that our breakfast were delivered on time and I must say, I really enjoyed our breakfast in bed. On the last day when we were about to leave we were greeted by the owner of this suite who came across as very professional and humble. They even gave us a free bottle of Italian olive oil as a parting gift! The queen sized bed was comfortable with extra pillows and blankets at our disposal. Room was clean and looked new. The location was definitely a plus as well. Just 2 minute away from Piazza Navonna and walkable distance to the main attractions such as the Pantheon and Spanish steps. I would definitely stay there again the next time we visit Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Random little place, but perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: chitowngatorgirl
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a "standard" hotel, this isn't it! Rome was last part of our 2 week trip, and we had gotten pretty use to the very modern hotels that we had stayed in while in Spain. It was more of a bed and breakfast style place than I think my friend and I were expecting, however it turned out to be great. We weren't big breakfast eaters however the pastries were tasty and the coffee was helpful early in the morning! The location is so perfect! I was in Rome a few years ago and had a completely different trip because we were so far away from the city's attractions, not this time though! This trip I was determined to really love Rome and Imperium Suite Navona really helped with that! I didn't know that they had a computer for the guests to use, but knowing that at the time would have come in handy. They were great about getting us car service to the airport too! I would stay here on my next visit without a doubt! **Make sure to google map the hotel because it is down a random side street and would have been challenging to find had we not had the map!**

Reviews.Title: “I love it”
Reviews.Author: Luzelena1
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a perfect location near plaza navona and other attractions. The rooms are nice specially the suite navona. the brekfast was very good juice, milk, coffe, croissant, jam, ham, and they tale it to your room at the time that you prefer. Waht is most important is the service, the personel of the hotel are 100% helpful. We really enjoy our time in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in central location.”
Reviews.Author: VAScout
Reviews.Content: This is a cozy 'hotel' that is part of a townhouse about a short block north of Piazza Navona. The location could not be better - within walking distance of all the major sites and very close to the river. It's about a 20 minute walk to St. Peters Square. Breakfast was promptly delivered to your room each morning, at a time specified by the guests. Although the hotel's website said there is free internet access in the common area, one staff member told me it's not 'permitted' when i asked to use the computer. Nevertheless, he let me use it anyway. So perhaps the hotel can clarify its internet use policy on the hotel website. Otherwise, this hotel is a great value in a wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: uoducks1999
Reviews.Content: After reading a lot of review on here, I was a little concerned about actually finding the hotel. Luckily another person on here posted a photo of the green door to where the hotel is. That really helped me out when I got there. I also posted a photo of the door, #19. The hotel is only 6 rooms, but that adds a lot to how much I enjoyed it. Breakfast every day (ham, cheese, bread, coffee, tea, milk, orange juice, fruit, bread) was a great start to the day. With the hotel being in the middle of everything, you do not need to get a taxi or jump on the Metro. You can walk to every where, Trevi Fountain, the Vatican, Piazza Navona, Panthenon, etc. The room was bigger than I thought. The tv has CNBC, Fox News and Bloomberg so I could always stay on top of what was going on back at home. This will be my hotel every time I go to Rome! If you have any questions, e-mail me at nord19 @ aol . com. (don't check this very often)

Reviews.Title: “Great once youve found it”
Reviews.Author: AncientScot
Reviews.Content: Appartment was a pleasant surprise but took some finding. It is an anonimous green door down a lane just off Piazza Navona, and I had to ask in a nearby bar where it was. The barman said everyone had to ask but we would enjoy our stay. Small room and shower room but all you need for a short stay. Staffed 24 hours and they make a decent breakfast. The situation is great and in a safe area.

Reviews.Title: “gracious, patient staff, generous, clean, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: americangirl00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed there this November for the first part of our honeymoon and loved this hotel--Roman and the whole rest of the staff answered all our endless questions about how long it took to walk to all the places we wanted to go, what they recommended for good restaurants, how much it cost to go where and how, and all sorts of other typical tourist questions. They are a gracious and kind staff who are polite and very unobtrusive. The rooms are quite large by Europe standards (though they do carry sound a bit from room to room) and super clean and low key elegant. The breakfast was quite good and we had the room which looked out over the street nearest the Piazza Navona--we would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: DanishTraveler_9
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is located only 2 minuts from Piazza Navona. 5 minuts from Pantheon and in walking distance to Sct. Pitro, The Spanish Steps and even Colloseum ect. It is perfect if you want to experience Rome by foot. The area is filled with nice italian restaurants and the atmosphere is fantastic. Imperium Suite Navona is a small place with only 7-8 rooms. The people are very serviceminded and they are very sweet. Breakfirst is served whenever you like in your own room and it is up to you what you would like. Cappucino, Juice, bread, salami, ham, cheese etc. Our room was quite small and in the mornings there were some noises from the street. Imperium Suite Navona is ablolutely worth visiting...

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: gopal_kumar7883
Reviews.Content: Very center Imperium suite navona and perfect for travelling out in all directions. Pantheon, Navona squre, Spanish steeps, Fontana di trevi, Campo di fiori very near Walking 5 to 10 min, 20 min walk from Vatican city . Rooms are very clean and modern.Staff were very friendly and helpful. Good service . We will be stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Italy_Travelers99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found this hotel by reading reviews on Tripadvisor. We were skeptical. After spending a week traveling Italy with a tour group we spent the second week in Rome by ourselves. The room was better than any we stayed at in Italy (except the Marriott). But for the price and location it was our favorite by far. Cramped spaces, hard to find, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “very central”
Reviews.Author: tonytripstar
Reviews.Content: Imperium suite navona is located about a block away from Piazza Navona,very central and perfect for travelling out in all directions. We were given a superior room, very clean and well equiped. th front desk clerks were very friendly and helpful, great about making restaurant recommendations. We have been to Italy several times before, staying at top appartaments hotel and without doubt the Imperium suit Navona is the best place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Mkorsgaden
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Imperium Suite Navona and from day 1 it was beyond awesome. Arriving at the hotel was a bit of a challenge as the road to it is not accessible to cars so the taxi driver dropped us of around the corner and in Italian told us where to go. Fortunately for us, we saw the maid sitting outside the hotel and she directed us to the second floor. Since the elevator didn't stop at the 2nd floor she took my fiance's bag and I took mine up the stairs. When we arrived to the top we met the owner of the hotel. He told us that having the hotel was his pride and joy and that he was very happy to have us. He was very friendly and told us to shower first and then we could check in. When we arrived in the room, we realized this was not a hotel but more of a bed and breakfast. The room is very romantic and very very clean. After showering and getting settled we left and met the person who would be in charge at night. Ramon, I hope I'm spelling his name correctly, really made our stay as awesome as it was. Since we were out most of the day and came home late at night, we would see him the most. He was always very friendly and always willing to help us out. Every night before you sleep, you fill out an order for breakfast. The breakfast was one of our favorite parts. It helped us save a lot of money. Its a very basic breakfast consisting of bread, meats and cheese but that is all you really need. The owner told us that he would get us anything we needed but we were very content with what it was. The location isn't right next to anything which is kind of nice because the big crowds are never near your window. Everything is within walking distance, though, or a very very cheap taxi ride. The bad reviews for this hotel really don't add up and I am convinced that they stayed some where else. All Italian TV really shouldn't be a problem. Get out of your room and enjoy some people watching. To rap it up, this hotel, is beyond awesome. The owner loves and it and you can tell. If we had one negative thing to say, I'm 100% convinced he would have tried his best to fix it. Fortunately for everyone, this hotel was simply perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel in the Heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: spbsfp
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in July and loved the hotel. It is actually 6 rooms and an office occupying the second floor of an otherwise condo apartment building on a quiet residential street. The rooms were well-appointed, the air conditioning worked well. David and Roman staff the all day and evening and are sweet, cheerful and tremendously helpful. The rooms are cleaned spotless every day, and every morning a great breakfast is brought to your room at the time you asked for. The hotel is quiet despite some of the early reviews (everyone now has keys to the front door and there is no buzzer ringing at night). The location is unbeatable. It is a one minute walk to Piazza Navona and a quick walk to the Pantheon, the Trevi Fountain, Campo De Fiore and the Vatican. There are dozens of restaurants of every type within a quick walk. On Rinascimento a block or two away there are bus stops that take you anywhere in Central Rome (the Coliseum, Villa Borghese, Termini station, the National Museum, the Capital). To get to the hotel from Termini Rail station just take the No. 70 bus outside the station and get off on Rinascimento. It is a good idea to print the picture of the exterior of the hotel as there is no sign. If you want a friendly, good-value, well-located hotel and can do without the lobby, this is a real gem.

Reviews.Title: “If You Want Best: It Is Imperium!”
Reviews.Author: PINTO2
Reviews.Content: To find a place from where one can move without any difficulty is the best thing to be happened for a tourist. In this way one can serve the time and money and then can get the maximum from the tour. If this is what you are searching, here is the place where you can find the best one wants: Imperium Suite Navona, situated between piazza Navona and Pantheon. Staff is friendly, rooms brand new and clean, break-first is delivered every morning to the room and one could order almost anything.

Reviews.Title: “Best decision made on this trip to Rome, location, service and hospitality superb,hope to return again!”
Reviews.Author: deturkpsu
Reviews.Content: Imperium Suite Navona is a jewel in the best part of Rome. My wife and I along wtih out two sons visited for 8 nights and couldn't be happier. Rooms were exceptionally clean, Rahaman and David went out of their way to make sure we had the best time from directions to sites to a great breakfast. The breakfast kept us going all day. We were able to not use a taxi once because the location is so centrally located. We saw the Pantheon, Colusseum, Forum, Vatican,atc all within walking distance. The Navona Plaza is filled with restaurants, artists, mimes, musicians of all sorts in the evening. It is with great pleasure that I recommend the great bed and breakfast. Steve Deturk

Reviews.Title: “Central and nice stay”
Reviews.Author: whiskyme
Reviews.Content: Accomodation is very good, with a most helpful staff. They guided us to the place with our car, and helped us along when we had to leave very early. There are only 6 rooms, so you get a bit closer to the staff than you normally do. VERY central location in Rome. Book early, and get a fixed price from and to the airport. We got a price for 80€ very early (04:30 in the morning) in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Feel Like A Queen”
Reviews.Author: margherit
Reviews.Content: there are a few hoteles in the world which once experienced will always draw you back ,and we can say now after a fantastic holidy in ROME that this hotel it's one of them, we were surprised by the location in the heart of rome while walking to the hotel we see navona square 2 minute on foot from the hotel ,pantheon ,spanish steps ,(via del corso) via condotti ,7 minutes to see trevi fountain realy you can walk everywhere immagine to stay ,5 minute walking to vatican ,it 's marvelous location .for the room we stayed in (navona) very unique ,spacious,superb room decor most conducive to comfortable living ,one of the other many things we especially loved about the hotel was the impeccable staff very helpful and friendly ,check in fast and effecient ,and every mornining i feel like a queen when i have my breakfast in my room.there is no doubt at all that if we ever return to rome we will go to imperium suite navona

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rugbyau
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Imperium near the first of April and had the deluxe room. It was large by Rome standards, and the beds were comfortable. This is not a 5 star hotel, but that's not what expected or looked for. It was very convenient, a fantastic location (Piazza Navona), and a great deal for the money. It was no more than a few km to all of the sites in any direction (forum, Vatican, Piazza Popolo, Spanish Steps, etc). If needed, there is a cab stand between the hotel and Piazza Navona. It is located in an alley, but the walk to the hotel from the cab is no more than 30 meters. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. Breakfasts were great. The walls were a little thin (we could hear the reception area), but we never had any problems. We would gladly stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressive”
Reviews.Author: eventhorizon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived by Taxi ( Rome Cabs that we booked in advance online ) and the driver stopped in an adjacent street (because you cannot get a large vehicle to the front of this hotel ) and led the way. Without the driver we would still be trying to find the place now , despite having some zoomed-in pictures from Google Earth with us! The reception guy was waiting at the door and was polite and friendly. We were led up a set of stairs to the first floor. There are about 6 rooms all on the same floor. We had booked the superior double room with jacuzzi spa bath. The reception area, and I use this term extremely loosely is a desk and chair next to a computer with a small kitchen area behind it occupying the landing and right outside the room we had booked. The walls are paper thin so you can hear the other guests coming and going and I could hear somone snoring all night! and the reception guy when he is on the phone and talking to the night porter guy when he arrives and leaves. Tip: take ear-plugs. The room was clean and looks like it was recently painted/decorated. The guy shows us the safety deposit box and tells me the code!!!! Tells me ? so I ask how I change it and he says " No, you must use the code I give You! " There was no way to change the code ! In 25 years of staying in hotels I have never been given a code to punch in that the receptionist knew and probably the night porter also. Anyways I fiddled around trying to see if I could change the code ( but could not when I noticed that the safe moved slightly....I then discovered that it was not secured to the wall. I picked it up and got the wife to take a photograph!
