( See the pics I have included. ) Needless to say we walked around Rome for 5 days carrying passports, 700 euros and our plane tickets...unbelievable! Next the jacuzzi spa. It didnt work..no bubbles for us. When I complained they kept saying they would have a look at it later, finally on the saturday night ( second day of stay ) they said it would be fixed Monday...and yes you guessed it, it was never fixed. We asked that first night for breakfast at 8 .30 am the next morning ( it is delivered on a tray to your room ..see pics of breakfast ) . Breakfast arrived at 8!!! we were still asleep when the guy began knocking ! Wonderful! There are no keys to the outside door. The hotel reception is manned 24/7 and when you arrive back from a night out you ring the bell. The bell can be heard in all the rooms, so you know when everyone is back if you keep count of the rings throughout the night like I did. The bathroom is very small and to get to the toilet you have to be very careful you dont injure yourself on the window handle like I did when you squeeze passed in the middle of the night ( see more pics of bathroom , window handle, my injury ) and speaking of death traps, see the pic I have included of the small step leading into the bathroom. If you sleep in total darkness or have been on the wine you will fall/trip/stumble on this obstacle. So, what was good about it? The bed mattress was very comfortable. The room was clean and the location good. It was a one minute walk to the piaza navona and 2 minutes walk to the bridge crossing the river. I would not stay there again. I would not stay there if it was half price or they phoned me and said it was a freebie. They need to address the noise/privacy issue...come on! someone sitting right outside your room !! That was probably the biggest concern for us. A door bell that wakes the dead. No security for all you money and important documents, unless you want to use a safe that anyone can pick up and walk out with or you are happy to share the code number with a guy you know nothing about! no english speaking channels on the TV. , no proper tea bags, unless you are into earl Grey, an early morning call that is much earlier than you request, a couple of safety issues in the room ( step and wndow handle ). For the same money we could have got a 4 star hotel a couple of miles outside the city with a swimming pool....and this is our intention for the next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and very central hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmol
Reviews.Content: This is a very small but good and cozy hotel. The Hotel is in fact an apartment in the historic centre of Rome. With the Piazza Navona, the Pantheon and all the narrow shopping streets just outside the door, you couldn't live more central. We lived in a very big, comfortable and clean room, combined with a big bathroom with jacuzzi. The breakfast is served in the room, and this is a very excellent breakfast! The only minus: The Reception was very near our room! We enjoyed our stay. Thanks to Gigi and the rest of the very friendly and helpful staff! :-) Jesper & Mette, Copenhagen

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Flyaway04
Reviews.Content: One of the best stays ever in Rome. Staff is friendly, rooms seem brand new and remodeled, clean and luxurious and quiet. Breakfast is delivered every morning to the room and one could almost order anything! As for the location, the best: 100ft from one of the most beautiful plazas of the historic city, right in the center of downtown. Safe and connected. Reccomended for all, family and business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent ...”
Reviews.Author: NielsCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: Normally I find it difficult to book a decent hotel in Rome where I am not ripped-off for a standard room. But after staying at Imperium Suite Navona, I have found a most recommendable place to stay. The hotel is perfectly located in the “old part” of Rome between Piazza Navona and Pantheon. It’s not your typical hotel as the “hotel” only has 5 rooms and in fact is an old renovated apartment. The room we had, a ‘Superior room’ with a king size bed, also contained a small wardrobe and a nice bathroom with Jacuzzi. Being an apartment, more than a hotel, you have the sound of people coming and leaving, just outside your room. However this was not a big problem for us. Also there is no big breakfast buffet (there is no restaurant) instead breakfast is served in your room at what time you choose. Based on reviews here on Tripadvisor we were warned that the hotel could be difficult to find, therefore I had printed a map from the website – without this, I think we would still be searching. The hotel is located in a very narrow street, which the taxi driver could not drive into, and the building bears no sign whatsoever that indicates a hotel. Only a green door with an intercom. When the door opens you walk into a dark passage and need to find your way up to the first floor. The staff in the reception was very friendly and helped us with maps of the city and recommendations. We only paid 85 EUR’s pr. night which I find is a barging in Rome for a decent room, but one also has to accept that it’s not a typical hotel. Personally we needed a clean, quiet room close to the major sights, and had no need for all the amenities you normally see at a big hotel. For this purpose, Imperium Suite Navona was simply excellent...

Reviews.Title: “NOT a 'hotel'...AWFUL!!”
Reviews.Author: conor4444
Reviews.Content: AWFUL Awful 'hotel'. We arrived to find a very sleazy italian man on the second floor of a building. He guided us to the 'reception' which consisted of a very small table in the middle of the corridor and proceeded to show us to our room. There is only 6rooms! Everyone can hear everything. When inside our room no further than 2metres from 'reception', we could hear EVERYTHING. We asked for the room furthest down the corridor approximately 10metres from 'reception'....although the room was clean we were asked to turn tv down, because the staff ~(one sleazy italian man) could hear it at reception... In addition our room had an adjoining paper thin door to another one of the 6rooms. truly awful!! Breakfast is served in room cause there is no-where else to sit or eat. Staff (only one on at any one stage) are very dodgy. There are NO facilities in this 'hotel' / 6 roomed second floor apartment that is under serious misadvertisement. Do NOT stay in this hotel. Also do NOT even think of staying in the luxury suite!! We had booked this but didnt even get to stay in the room. BAD BAD BAD HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: thomas_bradbury
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in one of the best areas in rome,for a base in the centre of the city it cannot be bettered.for price i would say its very good value. The hotel has been recently refurbished(maybe not to the highest standards)but was clean and the bed was excellent.we dont spend much time at the hotel so we were very happy with the satff,breakfast etc. if you want to stay in a great location for a very good price in a decent hotel this is the on.if you want a hotel with great grandur then stay somewhere else and pay twice as much.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING! This place is lower than a "Terrible" rating!!!!”
Reviews.Author: brahmabull136
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I booked this hotel 2 months in advance before we arrived in Rome. We got to our hotel, which was hard to find but thats not their fault, and were extremely excited after reading all the reviews. Come to our surprise a man, can't remember his name but i it started with an F-so we shall call him Mr. F, came running down the stairs all frantic. This is the lie he told us: Mr. S.. Oh thank god youre here. We have a bit of a problem. I hope you guys arent too upset. I was in Aspen, you know skiing like a lot of people. I was on the mountians going up and down, i was on vacation. But the employee that i hired, i dont know what he was doing. While i was on vacation he was smoking weeding in my office. Not doing anything. He was always on drugs and i dont know what he did. But the reservation came through and I remember i had it before I left. I think he put it under pile of junk and just did drugs. And so we dont have a room for you. BUT, i have a soultion to this problem. I have another room at a better hotel, its a 4 start hotel and its near the spanish steps. Its our sister hotel and if i had to chose, id pick that one over this one. He then asked us to come upstairs because the elevator wasn't working, which it was because i saw a woman go up the elevator after we took the stairs, and that he would have to call a taxi to take us his other hotel. We go upstairs and and he forces us to drink coffee and orange juice and acting very nervously he makes phones to the other hotel and taxis. He lets us know that if we dont like the other hotel we can come back in the morning because he will then have a room for us. He runs off downstairs to find a taxi and leaves us with his wife. We waited about 15-20 mins before he came back upstairs and said he found us a taxi to go to the other hotel and that he would pay the fare for the trip. Obviously, we had no choice but to go to the other hotel. We get into the taxi at 10:30pm and we were dead tired, hungry, and hating rome at this point. we arrive at the sister hotel which was called Fellini B&B. We arrive at Fellini B&B, and the man working at the desk checks us in and lets us know that Mr. F said to give him a call in the morning and let him know if you want to go back to the other hotel. if so, he will check you back into the other hotel. We go up to our room and we were not surprised to find the room was all the way in the back the last room, it was the UGLY(everything was green), heater was not working so we were cold the entire night, sheets were dirty with hair all over it but the bed was comfortable, internet kept logging us off, shower was clogging up, and the bathroom tiles were broken. The next morning, my fiancé called expedia to let them know what was going on and booked another hotel. We got a knock on the door while we were getting ready to leave and it was a woman working for the hotel telling us this. "Don't go back to the other hotel because we have room here and theres no need to go to the other one. OK? So stay, stay... You can stay here okay." Obviously, we knew were werent going to stay and didnt want her to bother us more so we just agreed and finished packing up. We took all of our luggage downstairs to check out and another man was at the front desk. I dont remember his name but he was a very tall man so we can call him Mr. T. This is what happened with him: Were here to check out. Okay, whats your name. Im Mr. S. he said: Ohh.....!!!!!! No, no, no, no, no.. You stay here with us, you stay here. You can't go because we wont let you. We told him we we already booked another hotel and that were leaving and we just need to check out and we already took it up with expedia. He yelled at us asking us if its really because the room is ugly and thats why we want to leave. And supposedly the truth is this hotel cost more than that one so you guys are very lucky to stay here. After fighting for 10 mins, he got really angry and told us to leave which is what we were already doing so it didnt really matter. If you look up Fellini B&B you will find that many other travelers have had similar experiences. These people are very unprofessional and I suspect that they are running some sort of scam. So travelers beware. Avoid at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! New in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: DC_travellers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small, but is perfect if location, quality and value is important to you. Imperium Suites is located within walking distance of most of the main sites in central Rome - not to mention being steps away from Piazza Navona. The staff was great; we cannot say enough good things about Gigi. He took great care of us, and prepared breakfast every morning for us which he personally delivered to the room. The rooms themselves are not huge, but are new and very clean. The bathroom is modern and clean and does the trick! We would happily stay there again as it combines location, value and a warm sense in the heart of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: parky74
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic. We booked it for location but we found it so lovely. The staff very helpful, Davide can suggest you nyce restaurant and how visit the eternal city in the best way to save time and money, consider it, this is important in this period. Breakfast in the room is romantic and you can order the day before what you want to eat in the morning. They clean every day and every afternoon the rooms. So we definetely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “what a great little place !”
Reviews.Author: grayandkath
Reviews.Content: We stayed at imperium suite navona for three nights in october, the staff couldn't have been more helpful, the rooms are newly refurbished and spotless. Its a bit of a pig to find just look for the green door and check the little buttons ! But once you've found it you are in an ideal spot for exploring Rome, the piazza navona is buzzing all day and well into the evening, a great atmoshere. The other attractions are all only a short walk away so no need for expensive taxis the hotel staff will provide a free map just be careful when crossing the roads !!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: lykketroll
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed to The Imperial Suite Navona for a week end and it was a very pleasant stay. Location: Near Piazza Navona and close to attractions. We walked a lot in Roma and it was nice to come back to the hotel to take a break. The room: Nice furniture, very clean and good bed! Service: very good. Helpfull and charming people working there. In short this hotel has all properties we required for a cozi , romantic and pleasant stay in Roma. I will try to book this hotel next time I will come back to Rome and I will recommend this hotel to friends

Reviews.Title: “A nice hello from Norway”
Reviews.Author: Glorbetrotter
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife and one other couple stayed for one weekend in Rome late august 2008. We booked two rooms in Imperial Suite Navona. We were very exited because of the size of the hotel, it had only six rooms. The hotel surprised us very posityvly. The rooms was nice and clean, the area was quiet, and it was just in the middle of area we wanted to see in Rome. You could go to all the famous places in about ten minutes. The staff was nice and we get good service, and we enjoyed to have breakfast in the room. We will definitly come back to Rome later, and if possible we will stay at the same hotel. We will also recomend the hotel to others that will take a trip to Rome. Best regards from Norway

HotelInfo.Name: Imperium Suite Navona
HotelInfo.Address: Vicolo Della Palomba 19, 00186 Rome, Italy
